body:
This PR is a demo for replacing our Boost Filesystem usage with [`std::filesystem`](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/filesystem) and includes dropping Boost System as a dependency. It includes a squashed down version of the changes from #19245. 

[A macro has been added](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7002c4ade0148c3273659208ae517b79822b289d), modelling how we check for `-latomic` to facilitate linking with `-lstdc++fs` when required. This is  ~GCC < 9.1 & ~Clang < 9.0, however not always. i.e you could be using Clang 7 on top of a GCC 9 installation (i.e Ubuntu Focal) and use `<filesystem>` without passing any additional arguments. i.e:
```bash
# clang++-7 -v       
clang version 7.0.1-12 (tags/RELEASE_701/final)
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /usr/bin
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/9
Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/9
Selected GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/9
...
# cat test.cpp
```
```cpp
#include <filesystem>
#include <iostream>

namespace fs = std::filesystem;

int main() {
	std::cout << fs::current_path().root_name() << "\n";
	return 0;
}
```
```bash
# clang++-7 -std=c++17 test.cpp
ð 
```

Using `std::filesystem` comes with some caveats such that we likely wont be able to use it for a while yet. This includes increasing our minimum required compiler versions to GCC 8 and Clang 7. As well as increasing our minimum required macOS to 10.15 (only recently increased to 10.14 in master).

I've tested this with GCC 8 on Bionic, Clang 7 on Focal & Apple Clang 12.0.0.

This doesn't include any changes to the gitian descriptors.
title: [POC] Use std::filesystem. Remove Boost Filesystem & System
